DataElement.preferredName: Lymph Node Pathologic Assessment Finding Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the status of whether the lymph nodes are involved with endometrial cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pathologic evaluation of lymph nodes in respect to their involvement in a disease process or condition.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.
